# Arrived in South Africa for Grand Safari and Ted & Fee‚Äôs wedding
first night dinner at Ted‚Äôs nice house

# A ray of hope
On this day I got an email from Paul Harvey saying he‚Äôll find me a job in London\.  

JEXIT was always the plan but from here on it was a reality\.   
\( March 2021 update while bored at my WFH desk\)

"},{"text":"In my L6 year at King‚Äôs Bruton I shared a study with Byron Mordan and Tony KuPaKing.

Bad acne on my back
Byron singing Cantonese songs with Tony




Upper six room

Having porn put on my walls seconds before a room inspection 
I was busy checking everything else having got my room tidy.  Scores & Strevens and may be David Macalease. ?"}]}
entries.text:
# KSB \- Lower Sixth bedsit\.
In my L6 year at King‚Äôs Bruton I shared a study with Byron Mordan and Tony KuPaKing\.

Bad acne on my back
Byron singing Cantonese songs with Tony




Upper six room

Having porn put on my walls seconds before a room inspection 
I was busy checking everything else having got my room tidy\.  Scores & Strevens and may be David Macalease\. ?

# Visiting Vacncouver



Beautiful British Columbia 

First time visit for Christmas 

3 month visit over the summer in my 2nd year of university 

Shaunessy Village 

First time to see Four seasons hotel
Visiting Blackcomb and Whistler mountain 

Thank you Roy Robinson for setting up the intern job\.

"},{"text":"While working at SSB, the Shiodome office of BNPP , around 2012, Steve Donhou and o would drink beers at the Drunk Bears pub just opposite the office. (Ê±êÁïô„Ç∑„Ç™„Çµ„Ç§„Éà) "},{"attributes":{"linkURL":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiodome"},"text":"wikipedia link"},{"text":"

Occasionally we would by some beers from a conveni and drink the beers in the open air space between offices.  

Suri ( IRL Yadagiri Pushpagiri) and I would walk along the pedestrian skyway after lunch up to the The Nakagin Capsule Tower (‰∏≠ÈäÄ„Ç´„Éó„Çª„É´„Çø„ÉØ„Éº)  "},{"attributes":{"linkURL":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakagin_Capsule_Tower"},"text":"wikipedia"},{"text":"

entries.text:
# Remembering BNPP‚Äôs Shiodome office
While working at SSB, the Shiodome office of BNPP , around 2012, Steve Donhou and o would drink beers at the Drunk Bears pub just opposite the office\. \(Ê±êÁïô„Ç∑„Ç™„Çµ„Ç§„Éà\) [wikipedia link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiodome)

Occasionally we would by some beers from a conveni and drink the beers in the open air space between offices\.  

Suri \( IRL Yadagiri Pushpagiri\) and I would walk along the pedestrian skyway after lunch up to the The Nakagin Capsule Tower \(‰∏≠ÈäÄ„Ç´„Éó„Çª„É´„Çø„ÉØ„Éº\)  [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakagin_Capsule_Tower)

Loved the Singaporean prawn tofu dish at the near by Singaporean restaurant 

I loved the various Pan\-ya\-san bread shops that would buy my daily breakfast\.
Vie de France
various convenies
independent bakery

"},{"text":"
Seeing actual muck spreading happening in neighbouring field - i.e. tractor pulls hug trailer of fermented cow pooh which is ejected from the trailer by thrashing chain. If you‚Äôre down wind of this display it will stink ... of fermented cow pooh.

Playing cricket for 1st time and being clueless.  Not liking it. 

Shooting team , being quite good, having my own gun.  Getting my school colours- to have a hordle boar üêó on my blazer jacket "}]}
entries.text:
# Hordle House
Sports activity\- Running to the Tank Traps a mile or two from the cliff entrance to the school\. 

Seeing actual muck spreading happening in neighbouring field \- i\.e\. tractor pulls hug trailer of fermented cow pooh which is ejected from the trailer by thrashing chain\. If you‚Äôre down wind of this display it will stink \.\.\. of fermented cow pooh\.

Playing cricket for 1st time and being clueless\.  Not liking it\. 

Shooting team , being quite good, having my own gun\.  Getting my school colours\- to have a hordle boar üêó on my blazer jacket

# Visiting Syndey Australia 1997


First business class flight \- top deck on a 747\.  
Sunset in Bangkok airport, just a 45 minutebstop over before jetting further eastward to hit landfill of Australia\.  \( Nearly there? Ha\! Another 6 hours flying\)


What prompted this? Seeing a photo of myself and Neil Khanchandani on a sailing boat in in Sydney harbour\.

entries.text:
# Fives \- the game the gloves
Fives was the game played at King‚Äôs School Bruton, a predecessor to modern Squash with similar rules\.

What can I remember?
It was less of a burden than the normal games like rugby 
it was quite enjoyable 
it was run by Paul Davies AKA Greeny

it hurt your hands especially on a cold day\.


![](dayone-moment://3F0E5E5FBAED48A78DCCB332448AF914)

entries.text:
###### Write about your first computer\.
VIC20, not the Commodore 64\. The VIC had tape player for loading such awesome games as hoppit\. But some games need an 8K ram booster, an additional purchase of some ¬£30 or ¬£40 pounds\.

School, Hordle House that is, had ZX81s and ZX Spectrums\. The ZX81 was hard work but the spectrum was an excellent device featuring reasonable Basic and games such as Elite\. 

At high school, i\.e Public School ie Kings School Bruton we got BBC Micro computers\. These were more evolved devices\. I remember the speech chip allowed the device to speak calling the command `say\.`   Say ‚Äòcheese‚Äô say ‚Äòpants‚Äô\.\. it was well programmed\. No matter what combination of F\.U\.C\.K it wouldn‚Äôt say the f\-word\. fu\-youka was as about as close as we could get\. Still it gave us experience of iterative solution methods ;\-\)

TRS\-80 hand held computer

FX\-7000G Graphical calculator during A\-Levels was fun\.

Psion 2 , Psion 3 and laterally the Psion 5 were all excellent devices I used in my early 20s\.

There must be other gadgets out there\.

# „Çø„É™„Éì„ÉÉ„ÉâËÄ≥ÁßëÁî®Ê∂≤

I used to get terrible ear infections\.  Especially after I first move to Japan in 2004\. This little green bottle used to be a regular thing for me\.  Holidays and everyday life  were disrupted as I had to make detours to doctors to get this prescription drug\.

I became very practiced at the Japanese for I have an ear infection\. Starting with the telephone reservation to se the JIBIKA \(ËÄ≥ÈºªÁßë\) then actually meeting the doctor, rapidly explaining  the situation and then of course go to the pharmacy \(Ëñ¨Â±Ä\) and presenting the prescription \(Âá¶Êñπ / „Åó„Çá„Åª„ÅÜ„Åõ„Çì\) 

From my 40s I‚Äôve been lucky and have had no more serious infections\.  I‚Äôve kept a bottle of this medicine in my wash bag for the times I feel a tingle in the ear and need to act early to avoid trouble\. 

All over the world this ear medicine is a prescription drug\.  Except in the Cebu in the Philippines\. In January 2012 we took a family holiday to the Philippines\. while wondering around the shopping maul near our hotel I walked into a Watson‚Äôs pharmacy on the off chance and got lucky\. Stocked up 

## Watsons:
Pharmacy as seen in Hong Kong and much of Asia\.  Useful to stock up on western toiletries when visiting from Japan\.\. Deodorant and shower gel were always must buy items\.  



![](dayone-moment://D0D7A8787F7B48F8802753C5977E1AE0)

entries.text:
# Starbucks in Vancouver

In the summer of 1993, after my second year at University I spent 3 months living in Vancouver, Canada\. Probably July to September


At the time Robin was working for a Vancouver based company, Pacific Asia, specialising in food packaging\. Roy Robinson, a co director of the company, invited me to come work in the Pac Asia office for the summer\. AWESOME\!

So why the Starbuck stickers? and why now?

Here in 2021, during the pandemic, I purchased a pack of House Blend SB coffee\. The smell of House Blend coffee took me back to the magical first moments of entering a Starbucks in West Coast America \( ahem, Canada\)\.

You could buy various blends of beans and each blend had it‚Äôs own sticker\. These were beautiful and collectable\. They now sit on the inside cover of my green diary\.

![](dayone-moment://2502287BA3FF4B339295F33C64A6A5F9)

"},{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"54B5814E-106C-41A5-963A-DC410B9B3D15","header":0}},"text":"

entries.text:
# Hoover Dam

November 2nd 1995 I visited the Hoover Dam in Nevada\.

My first few years of living in London were difficult and mostly unhappy\. To give me a boost my parents invited me to join them on the final leg of their round\-the\-world trip\. We were to meet in Phoenix Arizona\. They were coming in from New Zealand and I was coming from London\.

The whole trip deserves it‚Äôs own entries
- Tapatio cliffs hotel \- desserts , cactus, stars at night \- so different so beautiful 
- Driving to Vegas across the dessert 
- Being in Vegas
- Driving to California and into ‚ÄòFrisco
- Wallet and cards stolen\!

Visiting the Dam \-on our way to Vegas\.
You probably can‚Äôt even visit the dam now what with terror and security\.
Our guide know everything *EVERYTHING* about the dam
I stood on the date line with one leg in Nevada  at 4:15pm and the other leg in Arizona at 5:15 or so some such\. One is Mountain Standard Time and the other is Pacific Standard Time\.


![](dayone-moment://BD0E3FAFFCE64004A7AEA8DB279CD9BB)

entries.text:
# Travel Dates from my British Passport up to 30 March 2001

Original non standard shaped Blue passport\. Issued July 8th 1991 expired July 8 2001\.


# 1996
Arrived \- Istanbul Turkey \- 26\-Sep\-1996
Departed \- Istanbul Turkey \- 30\-Sep\-1996
# 1997
Arrived \- Tokyo Japan \- 30\-Mar\-1997
Departed Tokyo Japan  12\-Apr\-1997

Arrived Sydney Australia  10\-Oct\-1997
Departed Sydney Australia  17\-Dec\-1997
# 1998
Arrived New York 10\-Oct\-1998
# 1999
Arrived Sydney Australia  10\-Oct\-1999
Departed Cairns Australia 27\-Oct\-1999

Arrived \- Hong Kong 27\-Oct\-1999
Departed \- Hong Kong 29\-Oct\-1999

# 2000
Arrived \- Bangkok Thailand 03\-Dec\-2000 Flight BA10 
Departed \- Bangkok Thailand 09\-Dec\-2000 Flight BA11


Arrived \- Brisbane Australia 24\-Nov\-2000
Departed \-  Sydney Australia 02\-Dec\-2000

Arrived \- Tokyo Japan \- 5\-Nov\-2000
Departed  \- Tokyo Japan  15\-Nov\-2000

# 2001
Arrived \- Tokyo Japan 03\-Jan\-2001
Departed \-  Tokyo Japan 30\-Mar\-2001

# Weiss bier in Brussels 
It‚Äôs a Thursday evening and I‚Äôm drinking a solitary beer that‚Äôs been stuck at the back of the fridge for some time\.  It‚Äôs a white beer\.  Not my everyday choice\.  

Sniffing the fragrance of the beer took me back to the late 90s when I visited Fran and Trevor in Brussels\.  

Craig and I would take the Eurostar from Waterloo as it was then and have a jolly good time wine and dinning with the expats\.  

What else can I recall of visiting Brussels with Craig and then Anne

{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":791}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"B0798EDA-9BA9-44FD-AADD-6448900A877E","header":1}},"text":"Ales and BBQ at Hato‚Äôs Bar 
"},{"text":"
Somewhere in the back streets of Shibuya was Hato‚Äôs Bar.  This bar served low and slow smoked BBQ food and fine ales.  This style of food was new to Japan and enjoyed this place immensely.  

I guess I went there 4 to 5 times.  

On one occasion Reuters was buying.  Thank you Andy Cockburn for using your expense account. 

Another occasion I remember Paul, Simon, Amir and my self did a huge bike ride to Takao and back. This was before I got into road bikes so this was quite an escapade.  

On the way home we lost Amir who went home solo and didn‚Äôt tell us.  This was annoying and delayed our arrival at Hato. Thankfully they still had plenty of beer and some of their BBQ meats which were so well received after a full day cycling.  "}]}
entries.text:
# Ales and BBQ at Hato‚Äôs Bar 

Somewhere in the back streets of Shibuya was Hato‚Äôs Bar\.  This bar served low and slow smoked BBQ food and fine ales\.  This style of food was new to Japan and enjoyed this place immensely\.  

I guess I went there 4 to 5 times\.  

On one occasion Reuters was buying\.  Thank you Andy Cockburn for using your expense account\. 

Another occasion I remember Paul, Simon, Amir and my self did a huge bike ride to Takao and back\. This was before I got into road bikes so this was quite an escapade\.  

On the way home we lost Amir who went home solo and didn‚Äôt tell us\.  This was annoying and delayed our arrival at Hato\. Thankfully they still had plenty of beer and some of their BBQ meats which were so well received after a full day cycling\.

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":791}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"3E8F1463-3086-4725-A4B6-A669A3F8472F","header":1}},"text":"Takao Bike Ride losing Amir Ending at Hato‚Äôs Bar
"},{"text":"

I get many punctures on the way

Heat exhaustion 
Arrive at Takao. Simon and Paul bolt up the hill. Alex and Paul chill at the foot of the mountain.  

On the way home I learn I need a bright light to see in the proper darker cycling in the countryside.  

We loose Amir who‚Äôs phone had run out of batteries.  We spent so,e hours looking for him only to find he got home ages ago and forgot to call in that he was fine.   

Paul, Simon and I made it to Hato‚Äôs Bar in time to get a few fines ales and some delicious BBQ.  

A fine boys day out.  "}]}
entries.text:
# Takao Bike Ride losing Amir Ending at Hato‚Äôs Bar


I get many punctures on the way

Heat exhaustion 
Arrive at Takao\. Simon and Paul bolt up the hill\. Alex and Paul chill at the foot of the mountain\.  

On the way home I learn I need a bright light to see in the proper darker cycling in the countryside\.  

We loose Amir who‚Äôs phone had run out of batteries\.  We spent so,e hours looking for him only to find he got home ages ago and forgot to call in that he was fine\.   

Paul, Simon and I made it to Hato‚Äôs Bar in time to get a few fines ales and some delicious BBQ\.  

A fine boys day out\.

{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-mac","version":1311}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"02D79A25-BF6E-440A-8A1B-8A9D9BBCE6BF"}},"text":"Ascend the stairs at GTNT
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"BF07C1CF-168A-409A-A8D4-276568B53285"}},"text":"
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"672C5FED-128F-4EF2-B4A3-D1FD7CDFE79B"}},"text":"
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"28A68ED7-9A9E-4247-9D62-3E0C5955E524"}},"text":"it was while I was an APS Manager but before 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"F497C828-DE59-477B-BFC6-4708706148F2"}},"text":"I remember once at BNPP‚Äôs Tokyo office the lifts were out due to earthquake. 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"A1F10A37-0DF7-4A47-B368-B040D140DA4A"}},"text":"Above a certain magnitude a human  inspection was required or  some such.. it was 8:30am and it was use the stairs or wait‚Ä¶ 41floors. there were hundreds of staff waiting at ground level. Even if the lifts started now it would be 10-15 mins before I could be lifted. and  being a bank and IT support there was extreme pressure to get to your desk.. ( Mr Orr my then boss was quite clear on this) . because I used to hang out with these crazy fruitcake nut jobs [Simon, Paul and Joe] that hike around mountains a lot I was in good shape.. I knew I could go up the stairs, just had to keep a slow and steady pace.  It was with a huge sense of smugness that I arrived at level 41a little puffed but nothing more. Meanwhile the younger gungho trader who started the ascent with me tapped out to rest at level 30. A few others pushed thru but looked near heart attack [David Salle]  when the slumped on the floor at level 41.  Being fit feels great sometime‚Ä¶
"},{"text":"
I wish I used my Garmin watch to track the ascent but I remember thinking I‚Äôd rather a reliable watch then something running on batteries  so left the Garmin at home. 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"672C5FED-128F-4EF2-B4A3-D1FD7CDFE79B"}},"text":"circa 2016 or 2017 - the trader was called Teddy, I was living in Azamino"}]}
entries.text:
Ascend the stairs at GTNT


it was while I was an APS Manager but before 
I remember once at BNPP‚Äôs Tokyo office the lifts were out due to earthquake\. 
Above a certain magnitude a human  inspection was required or  some such\.\. it was 8:30am and it was use the stairs or wait‚Ä¶ 41floors\. there were hundreds of staff waiting at ground level\. Even if the lifts started now it would be 10\-15 mins before I could be lifted\. and  being a bank and IT support there was extreme pressure to get to your desk\.\. \( Mr Orr my then boss was quite clear on this\) \. because I used to hang out with these crazy fruitcake nut jobs \[Simon, Paul and Joe\] that hike around mountains a lot I was in good shape\.\. I knew I could go up the stairs, just had to keep a slow and steady pace\.  It was with a huge sense of smugness that I arrived at level 41a little puffed but nothing more\. Meanwhile the younger gungho trader who started the ascent with me tapped out to rest at level 30\. A few others pushed thru but looked near heart attack \[David Salle\]  when the slumped on the floor at level 41\.  Being fit feels great sometime‚Ä¶

I wish I used my Garmin watch to track the ascent but I remember thinking I‚Äôd rather a reliable watch then something running on batteries  so left the Garmin at home\. 
circa 2016 or 2017 \- the trader was called Teddy, I was living in Azamino

# Rupert and Cassie's wedding OTD 2009 

Today Robin chimed in in the Global Oultons WhatsApp group that it's was Rupert and Cassie's wedding anniversary\. 

In Tokyo in 2009 I decided I could attend one but not birth wedding ceremonies\.  I decided to attend the UK event and miss the California event\. 

Betty 
Baby boy Leo


What's in my paper diary for this time?p
